ygData.subject: Re: Infecticon tricks(ATTN: All of Darkfates Troops and Airly)
ygData.msgSnippet: That s what I mean. You condemn her to death. I think you don t have to. If airly wants to get her killed, then alright never mind what I said, but I dont

That's what I mean. You condemn her to death. I think you don't have to. If 
airly wants to get her killed, then alright never mind what I said, but I 
dont think you have to impose death anyways on her. I dont know she should 
get out of there, and sincerely, that's not my problem. I mean, just be 
fair!


>From: Legendarynemasis@...
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: Infecticon tricks(ATTN: All of Darkfates Troops and Airly)
>Date: Sat, 21 Jul 2001 00:38:46 -0000
>
>Its not supposed to end until she dies. The Infecticon test was meant
>to be a pass or fail thing. If you fail you die. It was established
>before the bet was made between the two. Darkfate and Airly had the
>choice to decline, but they didnt. I was actually expecting
>Blacknightmare to pass anyways. But she failed the test and that
>price is death. Also, how can she get out of the situation if you
>mind my asking? Shes under water in a very large facility. The only
>transport on and off can be activated by the main computer which can
>only be activated by the infecticon signature and brain waves. Not to
>mention the facility is heavily armed and can be sealed off to
>prevent escape.
>
>--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Azure The Warrior" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Well there's something else. I hate to say it though, I guess I'll
>end up
> > sounding like you lokking for mode everywhere =P. From what I made
>out, the
> > way you're going, the battle won't stop until Blacknightmare dies.
>That, to
> > me, is very abusive. There's no way you should decide that another
>player's
> > char has no way to get out of a situation.
> >
> >
> > >From: Legendarynemasis@a...

> > > > > > you re-post. Though it's not in the rules (Yan forgot to

> > > > > > holograms are images, and cannot do damage.

> > > > > >

> > > > > > > launching another large Chaochitan energy at

> > >For
> > > > >her
> > > > > > > there was no other escape from here except death, thus
>was the
> > > > >penalty
> > > > > > > for failing the test. Meanwhile Blight simply smirked at
> > >Darkfate
> > > > >and
> > > > > > > then turned and headed towards one of the walls.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Blight: "They will work. Or you will die. As far as I can
>see
> > >its
> > > > >a
> > > > > > > win-win situation for me."
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > With those words Blight walked through a new opening in
>the
> > >wall
> > > > >that
> > > > > > > sealed itself right back up after he left. He was now once
> > >again
> > > > >in
> > > > > > > the main control room of the complex, and soon a
>transmission
> > >was
> > > > > > > opened to all of Darkfate's troops, their frequency was
>also
> > > > > > > discovered when Blacknightmare was scanned. He chuckled
> > >somewhat
> > > > > > > before his message played over the comm lines of every
>single
> > > > >member
> > > > > > > of Darkfates men.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Blight: "This is Blight, of the Infecticons, your
>commander,
> > > > >Darkfate
> > > > > > > is now our prisoner. If you do not do as we say, we shall
>kill
> > > > >him.
> > > > > > > You are all to stop with whatever you are doing and are to
> > >come
> > > > >to the
> > > > > > > location of this transmission. You will recieve further
>orders
> > > > >from me
> > > > > > > then. If you need a landmark... just hover over the big
> > > > >whirlpool."
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Blight laughed to himself as he then pressed another
>button.
> > >Back
> > > > >in
> > > > > > > the part of the base Alecto was in, an anti gravity device
> > > > >activated
> > > > > > > beneath her and sent her flying out of the chamber and
>back to
> > > > >ledger
> > > > > > > and co. At that point the whirling water vortex greatly
>shrank
> > > > >leaving
> > > > > > > only a small entry point down to the same sealed off
>section
> > >of
> > > > >the
> > > > > > > base. And still at the bases' center a massive hole was
>now
> > >in the
> > > > > > > ground but all within the hole was metal and electronics
> > >beneath
> > > > >that.
> > > > > > > And still the nanites continued to build down deeper into
>the
> > > > >already
> > > > > > > seemingly bottomless thing.
